intro: Diandriella, commonly known as the sweetroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal and culinary uses. Diandriella species are generally perennial and can grow up to 1 meter in height.
